content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-024-09-B
|Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy.
|Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy.
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the frequency of hypertension
|Description=None
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle
|Order=9}}

High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 5-10% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

properties.question: What percentage of pregnancies are affected by high blood pressure, and of those, what percentage will develop pre-eclampsia?
properties.option_a: 5-10% of pregnancies are affected by high blood pressure, and 5% will develop pre-eclampsia.
properties.option_b: 5-10% of pregnancies are affected by high blood pressure, and 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.
properties.option_c: 15-20% of pregnancies are affected by high blood pressure, and 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.
properties.option_d: 10-20% of pregnancies are affected by high blood pressure, and 5% will develop pre-eclampsia.
